item.description:
THANKS TO LEIGH FOR PUTTING TOGETHER THIS OUTING

WHERE: Wood Neck Beach, Sippewissett in Falmouth, MA

WHEN: 3 hours starting at the posted time. There are two
parking lots, the 2nd is best to meet at.

THE SCENE: Beautiful beach with an old, weathered fence in a more
secluded area of the Cape. One side is the beach,
when the tide goes out, you can walk out forever in
the shallow warm water looking for hermit crabs,
horseshoe crabs and blue crabs.

On the other side is a river surrounded by marshlands
and beautiful Cape homes. Wear water shoes and you
can walk almost the whole river. Keep a look out for
heron and the snowy egrets nesting the marshes.

WHERE TO MEET*: At the posted time, with 1/2 hour leeway for late-comers. There are two
parking lots, the 2nd is best to meet at.

DIRECTIONS: Take the Bourne Bridge (or 6A if you go
over the Sagamore) towards Falmouth to Rt. 28. Go
about 7 miles (going through a small rotary near Otis
Air Force base) and when 28 ends, look for a sign for
Sippiwisset on the right (Palmer Ave.) then take a
left onto Sippewissett Road. Go about 1 mile and
there a small road called Wood Neck on the right.
Take that right, then bear to the left at a small fork
in the road, the beach is at the end.


OTHER:
LEIGH WANTED YOU TO KNOW:
Along Rt. 28 there are plenty of
convenience stores if you need soda, ice, water, or a
DD for an iced coffee. Also, if you want to go to the
area earlier there is a quaint, little sandwich shop
on Palmer Ave., on the right.

Google Sippewissett for a lot of great info and some
websites have pictures.

RSVPs: It's best to let us know you are coming so we can look for you or alert you to any changes.

THINGS TO BRING WHICH ARE OFTEN FORGOTTEN:
Mosquito repellant, Paper towels, Sweater, water, foodIF LOST: If you become lost getting there, call.

*LAX: We meet at the time above. You have 30 minutes additional slack, after which we may leave to the painting site without you.

INCLEMENT WEATHER: It is up to you to determine if the weather makes painting untenable. Although, I will try to leave a message on my voice mail if I myself do not intend to be there.




Michael Emerald
617/968-0627
westpointusma@yahoo.com
item.name: OUTING: Woodneck Beach, Falmouth
